thread.title_full: Health Ministry to act against those who spread classified info, internal circulars without authorisation - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: Health Ministry to act against those who spread classified info, internal circulars without authorisation - Nation | The Star Online
text:
PUTRAJAYA: The Health Ministry will take stern action against staff who leak classified information to the public.
Its minister Datuk Seri Dr S. Subramaniam said his office is not taking the issue lightly and will act against those found to have spread information and internal circulars without authorisation.
"I believe such problem do not occur just in my ministry but others as well.
"By leaking classified information, these irresponsible people are only causing panic and giving the public a wrong perception of the government. We will not tolerate this," he said here on Wednesday.
Last week, a Health Ministry circular on an increase in nominal dental charges for treatment at government clinics went viral, causing anxiety among the public.
The circular said that extractions, which cost RM1 now, would be increased to RM15, while the price of scaling would rise from RM2 to RM55 and fillings would increase from RM2 to RM25.
The ministry explained that the viral message on the new rates reflected basic cost of dental treatment for 2017 in Malaysia without subsidies and would not be imposed on patients.
Dr Subramaniam said an internal investigation was being conducted on the issue while the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission was carrying out a separate one.
"The culprits will be dealt with with disciplinary action. Previously, we issued last warnings to several staff who leaked information without permission," he said.
